column9: After breaking my leg in a car accident, surgery was performed and a metal rod screwed to the tibia to stabilize for healing.Several weeks later, a low level infection evolved of uncertain origins. Doctors agreed that it could be a reaction to one or more metals in the rod, and started Daptomycin to "buy time" for the leg to heal.I've been on it for about three weeks. So far, no obvious problems with the meds, although I am usually tired, but some days, not so much. I have allergies to many typical antibiotics, so I was surprised and happy when the dapto seemed to work with my system okay. I have appreciated having my pic line although once in a while, the tape around it itches, but it really hasn't been a big deal. My white cell count is "under control" and my bones continue to heal. Surgery to remove the metal from my leg is imminent, and then I can go back to my normal life. :)

column9: This medication was given to me after a 3 week treatment on vancomycin.  I was given this as an alternative b/c the vancomycin was yielding low white blood cells.  Upon administration the medicine did not show any reaction; however, within about 6 hours I began to get a rash on my chest.  The rash spread over my entire torso area, back, and upper legs.  In some places the rash was so bad that it just appeared solid red.  My face swelled up and even the sides of my nose became blistered.  The rash is itchy and uncomfortable.  Even after 24 hours the swelling and rash are very evident, if not worse.  It feels as though I have gotten a severe sunburn.  Taking benadryl has seemed to keep the rash/swelling from getting worse, but it has not help it go away.  I am not allergic to any other medications to my knowledge and this was the first reaction I have had like this.  The medication was delivered via a picc line.
